facts.1: Independence Day of Belarus, also celebrated as Republic Day, marks the liberation of Minsk from Nazi occupation in 1944.
facts.2: This day is celebrated with a military parade and fireworks.
facts.3: It has been a national holiday since 1996, replacing the previous independence day that was celebrated on July 27.

facts.1: National Fried Clam Day celebrates a beloved New England dish in the United States.
facts.2: Fried clams were first introduced by Lawrence Henry "Chubby" Woodman in 1916.
facts.3: The holiday is not federally recognized but enjoyed among seafood enthusiasts.

facts.1: Naadam is a traditional festival in Mongolia which starts on July 3rd, but the main events are held from the 11th to the 13th of July.
facts.2: Naadam officially commemorates the 1921 Revolution when Mongolia declared itself a free country.
facts.3: The three main sports of Naadam are Mongolian wrestling, horse racing, and archery.
